boat.name: Sea Dog
boat.full_description:
Sea Dog has been in Cork Ireland since the early 1960's. Owned by Stanley Roche in Ireland first we think then by various families and groups around Cork Harbour and Kinsale. The Hillyard club reckon she was built with extra keel for racing.


The current owner bought her in 2021 on the dry in Kinsale boat yard. A lot of work was done by George Kingston there and the hull seems fine apart form a damaged board at the heads outlet.


She has been dug into a field to make her easier to work on as she is 2.4m from keel to rail. The superstructure all needs doing hence the location and the dig. She sits in a shale bed surrounded by 15mm gravel so it free drains. Hopefully that will keep her from rotting. She is covered up to the gunnels to stop the sun totally drying her out. 


Repairs should be finished by mid 2023 when the owner hopes to get a mooring in Wicklow or Arklow.


He is looking to sail her around Ireland and to UK. She will be a family sailer and a boat to get away from life when needed.
boat.construction_details: Mahogony on oak frames. Deep keel. Copper fastened. Cockpit at rear.
